module.name: Logger Mule Extension
module.doc:description: This module relies entirely in runtime provided components (no other Plugin dependencies)

property.name: environment
property.doc:description: Execution environment name, typically loaded in a runtime property i.e: mule.env

operation.name: log
operation.doc:description: Logs enforcing output format and content

parameter.name: category
parameter.doc:description: Specifies a category name that it adds to the log trace, before the output object. You might use a category to route your log messages, or you might set log levels based on category

parameter.name: flowName
parameter.doc:description: The name of the current flow, sub-flow or batch step

parameter.name: correlationId
parameter.doc:description: Unique identifier value that is attached to messages that allows reference to a particular transaction or event chain

parameter.name: message
parameter.doc:description: Free text to describe context of logging this log or exception entry

parameter.name: content
parameter.doc:description: Can contain attributes/payloads for logs, or exception payload for errors

mule:set-payload.value: #[output application/json skipNullOn="everywhere", indent=false --- { level: vars.level, timestamp: now(), environment: vars.environment, applicationName: vars.appName, applicationVersion: vars.appVersion, flowName: vars.flowName, correlationId: vars.correlationId, message: vars.message, content: vars.content }]
mule:set-payload.doc:name: Set Payload
